JobFullDesc: About the Role  Uber is looking for a sharp, results-oriented, analytical operations specialist to join our US & Canada Rides Compliance Strategy & Operations team. If you love scaling processes, managing complex projects, working with cross-functional stakeholders, and diving deep into the details to create operational efficiency, then this role is for you. The ideal candidate will excel at solving complex problems, managing multiple workstreams, and engaging with stakeholders to deliver on key business goals that promote compliance and unlock growth. What You'll Do: Build, execute, and improve key compliance processes, ensuring that Uber’s business keeps running smoothlyCollaborate closely with different teams (e.g. Product, Legal, Engineering, Marketing, Community Operations) to develop and execute business strategies related to compliance. This includes things like supporting product rollouts of new compliance tech, owning compliance metrics and monitoring, developing compliance strategies, continuous process improvement and scaling solutions across the US & CanadaExecute on business critical regulatory and compliance processes to ensure we meet our legal obligations, including reporting, payments and auditsIdentify business priorities such as growth opportunities or operational weaknesses and help drive the team's strategy and improve or innovate processesPresent models, findings and insights to senior management to drive business decisionsThis role demands strong stakeholder and project management skills, as well as the ability to both plan and execute projects of varying time horizons and scope with minimal guidanceYou'll ensure high standards for compliance operations; you are an enterprising multi-tasker, driving cross-functional groups to decisions on strategic initiativesBasic Qualifications: Bachelor's degree requiredAt least 1 year of demonstrated experienceData-first problem solver with excellent Excel or data analysis skillsPreferred Qualifications:3+ years of experience in strategy / consulting / business intelligence / compliance or related experience Some high-growth operations, tech, or startup experienceSQL strongly preferred; other technical skills (scripting, macros, automation) is a plusProject management experience in a highly cross-functional setting, including with technical or product teamsClear communicator with the ability to work across business functionsSelf-motivated and self-starting - works well independently and possesses strong organization and time management skillsStrong, demonstrated leadership capabilities
